newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end modestly lower in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end modestly lower in thin trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended modestly lower on Monday, dragged down by profit-taking of blue chips amid signs of strength in the yen against the dollar and also by weakness in construction and banking issues after a medium-sized construction firm's decision to apply for court protection on Friday.
The Nikkei 225 fell 262.83 points or 1.32 percent to 19,705.17. Its September futures slipped 140 to 19,770.
"High-tech issues which were bought recently are starting to slow down, bringing on profit-taking," said Noboru Yorita, Tachibana Securities general manager.
